intro: Lepicephalus syriacus, commonly known as the Syrian lepicephalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several regions.
